content.description:
The question refers to the image shown of Fallingwater, a house designed by Frank Lloyd Wright.

© Art Resource, NY © 2013 Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation, Scottsdale, AZ/Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York
content.question: In Fallingwater, Frank Lloyd Wright’s decision to include dramatically cantilevered terraces that extend over the flowing water was made possible by the use of

choices.label: supporting piers driven into the creek bed
a giant boulder that anchors the central hearth

topic.text: 4.3: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Later European and American Art

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
